CatDescriptText: Lee Brun [LeeBrun] Johnson, social case worker, 7807 Kelly Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the hospital service rendered under Blue Cross plan is worth its present cost to the subscriber? Do you think the rates should be raised?  Why?" Answer reads: "I think that Blue Cross has a good value to the holder.  As to whether or not the increase is justified, I really don't know, because I'm not familiar with the rates.  Of course, I'm against any increase in rates."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of LeeBrun Johnson wearing light colored blouse with cutout pattern on short sleeves and bottom of bodice, standing in front of Faber Coe and Gregg of Penna. Inc. sign in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
